programme.title: The Ultimate Fighter
programme.desc: Follows the training and development of professional mixed martial arts fighters.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Butch Reynolds' relentless battle to clear his name reveals systemic flaws within sports governance and the enduring impact of false accusations on an athlete's legacy. As the documentary makes clear, the real truth is found beyond the headlines.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee brings his humor and candor to the microphone to highlight the day's top stories.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: In-depth, comprehensive daily coverage of all aspects of the NBA from expert analysts.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: The Point
programme.desc: ESPN's flagship hockey show featuring highlights, news, analysis, speed, skill and access to the biggest stars, stories and personalities of the game. Hosted by John Buccigross.

programme.title: Professional Fighters League
programme.desc: From Jon M. Huntsman Center in Salt Lake City.

programme.title: 2024 Stanley Cup Final
programme.desc: Edmonton looks to tie up the Stanley Cup Final in Game 6 versus Florida. The Oilers downed the Panthers 5-3 in Game 5 to extend the series, as Connor McDavid (EDM) moved within five points of tying Wayne Gretzky's single-playoff record with four.

programme.title: UFC Fight Night: Whittaker vs. Aliskerov - Prelims
programme.desc: Kyung Ho Kang vs. Muin Gafurov, bantamweight; Rinat Fakhretdinov vs. Nicolas Dalby, welterweight; Nasrat Haqparast vs. Jared Gordon, lightweight; Shara Magomedov vs. Joilton Lutterbach, middleweight. From Kingdom Arena in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia.

programme.title: WNBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Sparks and Liberty end a two-game set in the Big Apple. On this date 20 years ago, Hall of Famer Lisa Leslie scored 18 points and had five blocks in a 65-49 Los Angeles win in New York. Sparks rookie Cameron Brink suffered a torn ACL on June 18.

programme.title: Full Court Press
programme.desc: As top seeds in the tournament, Iowa and South Carolina aim to return to the Final Four. After the season, Kiki Rice focuses on the future with UCLA while Caitlin Clark and Kamilla Cardoso take center stage at the WNBA Draft.

programme.desc: Series of documentaries looking back through the history of sports.

programme.title: Formula 1: Grand Prix Sunday
programme.desc: Teams make final preparations for the day's race. Plus, interviews, features, and Martin Brundle's popular "grid walk."

programme.title: Formula 1 Racing
programme.desc: Formula One drivers begin their European summer with the Spanish Grand Prix. Max Verstappen won this event the last two years after Lewis Hamilton's run of five straight. Fernando Alonso (2006, 2013) is the only Spaniard to win this race.

programme.desc: From Red Bull Arena in Harrison, N.J.

programme.title: WNBA Countdown
programme.desc: WNBA news, analysis, highlights and interviews.

programme.title: WNBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Fever travel to play the Sky as Caitlin Clark versus Angel Reese round three begins. Clark's Indiana side won the first two meetings, with the Iowa standout falling two rebounds and one assist shy of a triple-double in the 91-83 decision June 16.

programme.title: Baseball Tonight: Sunday Night Countdown
programme.desc: Leading into each of ESPN's Sunday Night Baseball telecasts is this special edition of "Baseball Tonight." Host Karl Ravech teams with analysts and reporters to present fans a detailed preview of the network's exclusive, national game of the week. Highlights of the day's other games, interviews with players and managers, and key storylines from around the league also fill the hourlong show. Mark Teixeira, Eduardo Pérez, Tim Kurkjian and Buster Olney are among the analysts.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: David Peterson tries to keep his winning ways going as his Mets finish a set with the Cubs. Peterson is 3-0 in three June starts and sports a 3.97 ERA in four turns since rejoining the New York rotation after recovering from offseason hip surgery.

programme.title: E60
programme.desc: ESPN's morning sports magazine show, featuring the biggest names and stories in sports.

programme.title: The Last Dance
programme.desc: With Michael Jordan's extraordinary fame came extraordinary scrutiny, and in 1993, it all felt like it came to a head with the Chicago Bulls' pursuit of a third straight title shadowed by question marks about Jordan's gambling.

programme.title: The Last Dance
programme.desc: As Michael Jordan pushes his teammates hard for a sixth NBA title, his intensity and hunger for basketball dominance is in stark contrast to his mindset in October 1993, when he stunned the world by walking away from the game.

programme.title: The Last Dance
programme.desc: Michael Jordan would famously use even the smallest slight imaginable to motivate himself against an opponent. And when his NBA comeback in 1995 fell short in the playoffs, he worked harder than ever to return to form.

programme.desc: Shara Magomedov vs. Joilton Lutterbach, middleweight; Kelvin Gastelum vs. Daniel Rodriguez, middleweight; Sergei Pavlovich vs. Alexander Volkov, heavyweight; Robert Whittaker vs. Ikram Aliskerov, middleweight. From Riyadh, Saudi Arabia.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Butch Reynolds' relentless battle to clear his name reveals systemic flaws within sports governance and the enduring impact of false accusations on an athlete's legacy. As the documentary makes clear, the real truth is found beyond the headlines.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: On June 15, 2011, Vancouver hosts Game 7 of the Stanley Cup Finals between the Canucks and Boston Bruins; the city is a hive of nervous energy with the home team on the verge of its first-ever title, but when Boston stuns the Canucks to win the Cup, the situation quickly devolves into a full-blown riot, an orgy of violence that sees cars overturned and burned, windows shattered, businesses looted, and lawlessness reign... as hundreds of cell phone cameras capture it all.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Yankees-Dodgers: An Uncivil War
programme.desc: In 1977 and 1978, the New York Yankees and Los Angeles Dodgers squared off in back-to-back World Series. This ESPN Films documentary tells the story of a rivalry filled with colorful characters, seismic controversies and unforgettable moments.

programme.desc: Coverage of competitive cheerleading events.

programme.desc: On June 15, 2011, Vancouver hosts Game 7 of the Stanley Cup Finals between the Canucks and Boston Bruins; the city is a hive of nervous energy with the home team on the verge of its first-ever title, but when Boston stuns the Canucks to win the Cup, the situation quickly devolves into a full-blown riot, an orgy of violence that sees cars overturned and burned, windows shattered, businesses looted, and lawlessness reign... as hundreds of cell phone cameras capture it all.

programme.title: 2024 UEFA European Championship
programme.desc: Spain plays Italy in Gelsenkirchen in Group B of the 2024 European Championships. These teams have met seven times at the European Championships, the most played fixture in EUROs history. This includes a 4-0 Spain win in the EURO 2012 final in Kyiv.

programme.title: 2024 UEFA European Championship
programme.desc: Denmark plays England in Frankfurt am Main in Group C of EURO 2024. England beat Denmark 2-1 after extra time at Wembley Stadium in the semi-finals of EURO 2020. Harry Kane scored the winner from a rebound after Kasper Schmeichel saved his penalty.

programme.title: 2024 Copa America
programme.desc: Group A.

programme.desc: Highlights from the European Championship event.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: The Giants and Cardinals play at Rickwood Field. The oldest professional baseball park in the United States was home to the Birmingham Black Barons of the Negro Leagues, where Willie Mays played when he was 17. Mays passed away at 93 on June 18.

programme.title: The Carton Show
programme.desc: Craig Carton, one of New York's best-known voices, analyzes and debates the biggest headlines in sports each morning.

programme.title: Undisputed

programme.title: Euro Today

programme.title: 2024 UEFA European Championship
programme.desc: Poland plays Austria at Olympiastadion in Berlin in Group D of the 2024 European Championships. The only major tournament meeting was a 1-1 draw in Vienna in the EURO 2008 group stage. Ivica Vastic equalised with a 93rd-minute penalty for the hosts.

programme.title: United Football League
programme.desc: The Stallions and Brahmas meet in the inaugural UFL championship game. Birmingham trailed by 15 points late in the second quarter, but rallied to beat Michigan 31-18 for the USFL Conference title. San Antonio ousted St. Louis 25-15 in the XFL final.

programme.title: Refuse to Lose: Jeff Gordon and the 1997 Daytona 500
programme.desc: A revealing and personal look at Jeff Gordon, Ray Evernham, and the 24 team in the 12 days leading up to their victory in the 1997 Daytona 500.

programme.title: Golf PGA Tour
programme.desc: La temporada del PGA Tour termina con la ronda final del Travelers Championship, el último evento emblemático de 2024. Arnold Palmer ganó este torneo dos veces en un desempate, mientras que Billy Casper, ganador de tres majors, es tetracampeón.

programme.desc: Suiza se enfrenta a Alemania en el Grupo A de la Eurocopa 2024. Desde Deutsche Bank Park, en Fráncfort, Alemania.
